pullRequest.body:
As a further step in the direction of Dirichlet's Theorem on primes in AP, this PR adds results on (negative) logarithmic derivatives of `L œá` for a non-trivial Dirichlet character `œá` and of `s ‚Ü¶ (L œá s) * (s - 1)` when `œá` is trivial.

See [here on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/144837-PR-reviews/topic/Prerequisites.20for.20PNT.20and.20Dirichlet's.20Thm/near/482543603).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [89eb265b39](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19254/commits/89eb265b39df93c31d2b03ad925abb27b7b322eb)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LFunctionTrivChar‚ÇÅ`
`+ LFunctionTrivChar‚ÇÅ_apply_one_ne_zero`
`+ continuousOn_neg_logDeriv_LFunctionTrivChar‚ÇÅ`
`+ continuousOn_neg_logDeriv_LFunction_of_nontriv`
`+ deriv_LFunctionTrivChar‚ÇÅ_apply_of_ne_one`
`+ differentiable_LFunctionTrivChar‚ÇÅ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

:v: MichaelStollBayreuth can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
@loefflerd Thanks! I made the suggested changes.
bors d+

This looks great! I found a way of optimising out one lemma, and a few minor golfs. I'm really happy that we're closing in on PNT and PNT-AP now.

maintainer delegate
bors d+

```suggestion
lemma deriv_LFunctionTrivChar‚ÇÅ_apply_of_ne_one {s : ‚ÑÇ} (hs : s ‚â† 1) :
```
Maybe `differentiable_LFunctionTrivChar1`, for consistency with `deriv_LFunctionTrivChar‚ÇÅ_apply_of_ne_one` and other lemmas below?
Here `simp` is making this more complicated than needed: the proof is just `Function.update_noteq hs ..`. Since this is shorter than the name of the lemma, we can just inline it at the points of use.
Inlining doesn't work so well, so I'll keep the lemma with the simpler proof.
OK, it does, as you've demonstrated :smile: . So I'm removing it, after all...
(deleted)
(I was just being lazy; replacing by the inlined proof gave errors...)

alternative (not clear if it's better):
```suggestion
  simpa only [ne_eq, sub_ne_zero, one_eq_inv, Nat.cast_eq_one] 
    using (Nat.prime_of_mem_primeFactors hp).ne_one
```

```suggestion
    fun _ hs ‚Ü¶ Function.update_noteq (Set.mem_diff_singleton.mp hs).2 ..
```

```suggestion
    refine eventuallyEq_iff_exists_mem.mpr ?_ |>.deriv_eq
    exact ‚ü®_, isOpen_ne.mem_nhds hs, fun _ hw ‚Ü¶ Function.update_noteq (Set.mem_setOf.mp hw) ..‚ü©
```

```suggestion
  ¬∑ rw [LFunctionTrivChar‚ÇÅ, Function.update_noteq hw', mul_ne_zero_iff]
```

```suggestion
  simp only [neg_div]
```
(saves a few hundred heartbeats)

pullRequest.title: feat(NumberTheory/LSeries/DirichletContinuation): results on logarithmic derivatives
